watching.title: The Magical Revolution of the Reincarnated Princess and the Genius Young Lady
watching.text: I’m biased because I liked the LN, but so far this seems like a good adaptation. The animation, storyboarding, direction, and voice work all give me a good impression.

watching.title: Giant Beasts of Ars
watching.text: Protag is a "prototype" who escapes from some facility. Beast Hunters are people who fight Giant Beasts. Presumably they will meet at some point. First episode was promising.

maybe.title: Adventurers Who Don't Believe in Humanity Will Save the World
maybe.text: Non-isekai fantasy. Guy is kicked out of his party and dumped by his girlfriend. Meets 3 other similarly downtrodden adventurers at a tavern, they form a party. Seems very D&D.

maybe.title: The Iceblade Sorcerer Shall Rule the World
maybe.text: Non-isekai fantasy. Protag is the first "Ordinary" (non-noble and not decended from a sorcerer) to be admitted to the magic academy. Seems interesting. It's not a harem anime yet but looks like it'll become one.

maybe.title: Endo and Kobayashi Live! The Latest on Tsundere Villainess Lieselotte
maybe.text: When two otome gamers decide to commentate over a game as if it were a sporting event, suddenly one of the in-game characters can hear them and the gameplay changes in response to their commentary. They decide to try and create a route where the villainess isn't doomed.

maybe.title: Tomo-chan is a Girl!
maybe.text: idk yet. I feel like I could really like a good tomboy romcom, but the delivery feels somewhat lacking. Maybe the real problem is that the friend is more interesting than the leads (The Shikimori Effect).

maybe.title: Spy Classroom
maybe.text: I read the first volume of the LN. Post-war spy stuff. A bunch of underachieving spies-in-training are called to form a new team under the instruction of the “world’s greatest spy”. The adaptation seems fine, but I don’t have high hopes for it.

skipping.title: Sugar Apple Fairy Tale
skipping.text: Humans subjugated fairies long ago, and now treat them as slaves. Protag is from a family of confectioners, and her mother teaches her to respect fairies. She buys a warrior fairy to protect her while travelling to a confectioners' festival/competition, with the intent of freeing him once they arrive.

skipping.title: Revenger
skipping.text: First ep is all setup. Not sure what it’s actually about yet. There's nothing there to hook me yet.

skipping.title: The Ice Guy and His Cool Female Colleague
skipping.text: When he gets emotional he causes a localized blizzard. His coworker is cute but stoic. They get kinda blushy for each other. It’s cute but feels more like a montage of short skits than anything.

skipping.title: Farming Life in Another World
skipping.text: I WANT A GOOD FARMING ISEKAI. This probably isn't it.

skipping.title: Onimai: I’m Now Your Sister!
skipping.text: An eroge gamer NEET is secretly given an experimental drug by his genius sister and wakes up as a girl. I'll watch one episode of any gender-themed anime but this one doesn’t really have anything going for it.

skipping.title: Technoroid: Overmind
skipping.text: BOYS BOYS BOYS. In a futuristic world where global warming is real, so are android idols! Also they’re in debt because apparently nobody told them that using electricity to recharge would cost money (also, has nobody been collecting rent?? how did they go so long without anybody mentioning this??).
